column1: Harshad Chopda (born 17 May 1983) is an Indian television actor known for his portrayal of Prem Juneja in Kis Desh Mein Hai Meraa Dil
column2: Anurag Ganguly in Tere Liye and Captain Aditya Hooda in Bepannah.

column1: Chopda started his acting career in 2006 with Zee TV's Mamta where he played Karan Srivastav. From 2006 to 2007
column2: he portrayed Cadet Ali Baig in SAB TV's Left Right Left. Next
column3: he joined Sony TV's Amber Dhara as Akshat Mehra opposite Kashmira Irani.From 2008 to 2010
column4: he portrayed Prem Juneja in Star Plus's Kis Desh Mein Hai Meraa Dil opposite Additi Gupta. From 2010 to 2011
column5: Chopda played Anurag Ganguly in Star Plus's Tere Liye opposite Anupriya Kapoor for which he won the Indian Television Academy Award for GR8! Performer Of The Year and the Indian Telly Award for Best Actor Popular.From 2011 to 2012
column6: he played Mohan Gala in NDTV Imagine's Dharampatni opposite Aasiya Kazi. About his role he said: “Mohan is a commoner. He doesn't relate to many things in the world and only vaguely understands rituals and socialising.” In 2012
column7: he portrayed Raghavendra Pratap Singh in Life OK's Dil Se Di Dua... Saubhagyavati Bhava? opposite Sriti Jha and Karanvir Bohra. From 2014 to 2015
column8: he played Sahir Azeem Chaudhary in Sony TV's Humsafars opposite Shivya Pathania. When asked about his character
column9: he explained: “Sahir is a very complex one. He has a lot of shades. He is more than what meets the eye. It is an interesting challenge for me to play such a character on-screen.”In 2017
column10: Chopda made his film debut as Rahul in 2016 The End co-starring Priya Banerjee
column12: he came back to television with Colors TV's Bepannah
column13: portraying Captain Aditya Hooda opposite Jennifer Winget. Talking about his character
column14: Chopda said: “Aditya is very emotional and intelligent. He has a mathematical approach towards life
column15: and his vision is divided between black and white; he doesn't understand grey. Since he is a pilot
column16: he works on things with full focus and is shattered when his perfect world comes crumbling down.” Bepannaah made a successful debut
column17: entering the list of top five shows in its very first week. Times of India wrote “Harshad Chopda is a complete natural and plays his part effortlessly.” India Today stated “Harshad nails his character of Aditya with some black humour and hard-hitting one-liners.” Chopda won several awards for his portrayal including one Indian Television Academy Award for Best Actor Popular
column18: two Asian Viewers Television Awards for Male Actor Of The Year and one Lions Gold Award for Best Actor Popular.

column2: Chopda was listed 16th in Times of India's Top 20 Most Desirable Men on Indian Television List.In 2018
column3: he was placed 19th in Eastern Eye's 50 Sexiest Asian Men List. His chemistry with Jennifer Winget in Bepannah won them the title of Times of India's Most Favourite Onscreen Jodi 2018. Next
column4: Chopda topped Biz Asia's TV Personality List 2018. He was also listed 8th in Times of India's Top 20 Most Desirable Men on Indian Television 2018.In 2019
column5: he was placed 6th in Eastern Eye's 50 Sexiest Asian Men List. Next
column6: he was listed 8th in Times of India's Top 20 Most Desirable Men on Indian Television 2019.
